p: For the sixty-three proteomes analyzed ( Table 1), we obtained a total of 685,096 proteins classified into 382,502 orthogroups or OrthoMCL-defined protein families. Clustering analysis of pan-genome showed that under the set parameters (see Methods section for more information), 2,631 orthogroups, contain unique proteins only from species of Fusarium genus ( Fig 1). Regarding species-specific proteins, on average 3,941 orthogroups resulted like specific for each of the species included within the Fusarium complex ( Fig 2). As expected, the number of orthogroups with shared proteins between some of the compared species is smaller, to the extent that the number of species included in the analysis is increased.
